absorption (math concept)

See also

AbsorptionDeclaration (python class) | AbsorptionInclusion (python class) | absorption (python sample)

Definition

absorption is the well-known and valid inference-rule in propositional-logic:

\[\left(P \implies Q\right) \vdash \left(P \implies P \land Q\right)\]

Where:

  • \(P \implies Q\) is a formula-statement

  • \(P\) is a propositional formula

  • \(Q\) is a propositional formula

In straightforward language, if P implies Q, it follows that P implies both P and Q.

Bibliography

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absorption_(logic)
